name: Avoid BDV auto-rotation upon initalization
Deconvolution fixes
body:
Fixed non-CUDA block wise deconvolution
Fixed FFT Convolution
Block non-supported CUDA calls

name: CZI Importer fixes
body:
- Read channels & illuminations correctly (before it was a mixup)
- Read the rotation axis right again (changes in bioformats)

name: Decon-Fix, Slidebook Img Loader, Bake BDV Transforms
body:
- Fixed significant bug in the Multiview Deconvolution that applied the same update step twice, making it way less stable than it actually is: https://github.com/fiji/SPIM_Registration/commit/ee23cd09842d90fa229755ca45d48b9ba46d1c24
- Added the Slidebook6 ImgLoader, thanks @RichardMyers 
- Added the BakeBDVTransform to allow easy manual alignment, thanks @tpietzsch

name: Bugfixes, Java 8
body:
Workaround for Bioformats image stack size bug
Java 8
New version of BDV + spimdata (with Tiles)

name: Center-of-Mass Registration, Limit of Interest Points, no Java3D dependency
Fix debug deconvolution from last release (do not use 3.0.4!)
Clean up threads when using CUDA
Fix Deconvolution Memory Problem, fix Java3d problem
Fix for Multiview Deconvolution
body:
Uses significantly less RAM
Update the memory estimation

name: Max-Projection
body:
Now supports Max-Projection for all viewsetups.
Bug fix by @dietzc on dimensions of an interval.

name: ImgLib2 deconvolution, DHM Imgloader, LightsheetZ1 applies transformation
body:
Changelog:
- new imglib2 implementation of multiview-deconvolution, uses significantly less RAM
- new DHM imgloader
- LightsheetZ1 imgloader supports application of approximate transformation from metadata
- LightsheetZ1 imgloader suggests more useful channel names
- ImageJ imgloader does not fail if it is 2d+ch or 2d+t instead of 2d+z -- always assumes 2d+z

name: Bugfixes
body:
- several bugs in multichannel processing & deconvolution fixed
- update BDV after removing transformations
- fix bug in resave tiff
- fix detection id's if no subpixel localization is used
- fix Lightsheet Z1 opening for more than 10 angles
- javadoc fixed

name: New features for ImgLoaders
body:
- MicroManager ImgLoader now support multiple TIFFs (https://github.com/bigdataviewer/SPIM_Registration/commit/f6ff120d9cd3fd2a87ee341929a13dc0df6047bc, https://github.com/bigdataviewer/SPIM_Registration/issues/34)
- MicroManager ImgLoader tolerates dropped frames (https://github.com/bigdataviewer/SPIM_Registration/commit/a050eedc75c574f8ec10c2edc59bc47e0ca00352)
- ImageJ ImgLoader can now open 32bit as 16bit by asking the user how to scale the intensities. This allows automatic resaving of multiview deconvolution results as HDF5 (https://github.com/bigdataviewer/SPIM_Registration/commit/52e975f73f97d2cc18201fe9c82431379853f4c6, https://github.com/bigdataviewer/SPIM_Registration/issues/46)

name: Bugfixes
body:
- LOCI ImgLoader does not fail on empty metadata
- Changing Macro Recording name of manual bounding box back
- Predefined bounding box can be recorded only by name now, no actual values necessary anymore

name: Bugfix in output compared to previous release version
body:
Please see here: https://github.com/bigdataviewer/SPIM_Registration/releases/tag/SPIM_Registration-2.3.5
Additionally: Fixed RANSAC output https://github.com/bigdataviewer/SPIM_Registration/commit/55864ffb8aff9ea1d4ae9b31681a4e115863d1b8

name: New Statistics feature, bugfixes
body:
- the Timelapse registration statistics are finally back (can be selected under Interest Point Registration if multiple timepoints are registered)
- fix metadata import for Lightsheet Z1 with Bioformats 5.1.1
- fix bugs in predefined bounding box

name: External Bounding Box Definition
body: This release now allows to define and store a bounding box independent of the fusion enabling the user to for example automatically estimate and re-orient a bounding box based on the nuclei in one channel and then apply it for the fusion in another channel.

name: Release 2.3.3 - bugfixes
body:
- Can append/export 32-bit data to HDF5 by converting it to 16 bit
- Fix macro programming issue because of '[' brackets
- Build against new version of bigdataviewer-core that fixes the unsigned 16bit opening problem
- Less verbose output if corresponding interestpoints are not found

name: Fixed severe bug in HDF5 export with missing views
body: Commit https://github.com/bigdataviewer/SPIM_Registration/commit/945343cd9cc970aebc1d856b27c60f7823f55167

name: Integration of BigDataViewer
body:
This major release features a few substantial changes done at the hackathon at HHMI Janelia with @tpietzsch, mostly related to the user interface and performance.

Performance:
- Use already downsampled versions from the HDF5 container for segmentation if the desired downsampling (or a subset of it)  is available in the HDF5
- Use Monolithic image loader for full-size HDF5 image loading

Extensions to the new MultiView Reconstruction Application:
- Integration with BigDataViewer (BDV):
       - all changes to the data are shown in real time
       - currently selected views are shown in BDV
       - Bounding Box can be defined using BDV
- Appending of 16-bit HDF5 datasets is now possible (thanks @tpietzsch)
- Interactive display of detections and corresponding detections in BDV when selected in the Interest Point Explorer
- Allow to remove first/last registrations
- BDV-based reorientation of the sample

General:
- Use OME 5.1 (thanks @ctrueden)

Bug Fixes:
- Fixed timepoint registration
- Fix the name of the CUDA dialog so it is macro recordable
- Support older versions of the MicroManager format
- Sorting of rows in MultiView Application works again
- Asking for right PSF's for deconvolution works (thanks @nicost)
- Fixed NullPointerException if list of detections is empty
- save XML after resaving dataset
- Interactive DoG and InteractiveIntegral use min/max intensity settings

name: Fixed a major bug in MultiView Deconvolution
MultiView Reconstruction Application
body:
![mvr bdv-1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1420587/7045593/8d098f48-ddcd-11e4-8798-d57d7e8f3547.jpg)
Release 2.1.8 features a completely new MultiView Reconstruction Application, integrated with the BigDataViewer. It allows interactive reconstruction of multiview datasets (or just timelapse data). All previous individual plugins are still available under 'Batch Processing'.

Other Major Changes:
- Direct support for MicroManager diSPIM datasets
- When converted to HDF5, 'BigDataViewer (ON/OFF)' can be active all the time, showing every update in registration interactively
- In the 'Registration Explorer (ON/OFF)' it is possible to delete/add/edit individual transformations of views
- In the 'Interest Point Explorer (ON/OFF)' it is possible to delete/view individual detections
- All plugins are based on a List<ViewId> now, which makes it much easier to call programmatically

Minor Changes:
- MultiView Reconstruction Application does not save anything until 'save' is clicked, all batch plugins always save the XML (therefore the 'do not save registrations' is gone in the registration dialog)
- Many minor bugfixes for multichannel processing as reported by @StephanJanosch
- The geometric hashing has a new parameter that supports to set the required significance (ratio from best to second best match) to be considered a correspondence candidate

name: Fixed cluster processing & Lightsheet Z.1 import
body:
Fixed a bug in the interestpoint detection plugin:
- Number of channels are inquired already in the dialog
- In the dialog, the channel name is only used if there are more than one channel (this way macro recording does not require the name of the channel if there is only one)

name: Support Cluster Processing
body: Supports distributed processing by saving different XML's and allowing to merge the results.

name: plugins.config entries put back in
body: All plugins.config entries are now part of this project again as the BigDataViewer is now in main Fiji.

name: Fixed some major issues
body:
The major points addressed in this release are:
- ICP works correctly
- Number of Threads is configurable (for Cluster Processing)
- complete support for CZI files (even if all data is in one file)
- Fixing tiles is now configurable
- Simplified registration panel

Technically:
- Using ImgLib2 release version
- Fixed NullPointerException when the user provides the Point Spread Function(s) instead of extracting then from fluorescent beads
